intro: Strobocalyx doniana, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by round, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. Its latex sap is milky and has been used traditionally for various purposes, including as a natural rubber source. The tree is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife and soil stabilization.
